name: Karan

education.degree: Master of Science in Industrial Engineering
Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering

responsibilities: Advised clients on Data & AI strategies, focusing on the design and implementation of modern data architectures.
Identified use cases for AI-driven business process optimization and supported proof-of-concept development.
Facilitated workshops on data-driven innovation and digital transformation.

experience.role: Research Associate – Digital Twins & Data Architecture
responsibilities: Led interdisciplinary work packages in projects across energy, aerospace, and manufacturing sectors.
Developed data and process architectures for Digital Twin solutions and integrated AI applications for predictive maintenance and condition monitoring.
Modeled data flows, defined system interfaces, and managed data consistency across heterogeneous environments.
Supervised a student data science team and coordinated the design of prototype AI applications.

career_summary: Karan Moallim is a data-driven innovation specialist with strong experience at the intersection of engineering, digital transformation, and AI. He combines analytical thinking, domain understanding, and system-level design skills to develop sustainable digital solutions. His professional journey spans applied research and consulting, where he contributed to building digital twins, data architectures, and AI-based process optimization strategies for industrial and energy sectors.
future_goals: Shape scalable AI and Data Products that drive efficiency and sustainability.
Bridge domain expertise with technical innovation to support the energy transition and industrial transformation.
Expand leadership in interdisciplinary teams focusing on digital ecosystems and smart data use.

availability.preferred_location: Berlin, Germany or hybrid/remote in EU
